title: Convicted Abortion Doctor Reveals Shocking Connection To Actor Will Smith
text:
Convicted Abortion Doctor Reveals Shocking Connection To Actor Will Smith "... confidence in eventual vindication ..." Advertisement - story continues below 
The Daily Mail released shocking information Tuesday concerning convicted abortionist Dr. Kermit Gosnell. 
In an exclusive report, the news outlet revealed that actor Will Smith was delivered by Gosnell. 
Gosnell wrote a letter to the Fresh Prince star dated Nov. 14 in which he stated, “I’m fond of asserting that there could never be a Men in Black if I had dropped you on your head.” Advertisement - story continues below On The Eve Of Annual March For Life, ‘The View’ Co-Hosts Argue Everyone Is ‘Pro-Life’ 
Smith’s grandmother, Helen Bright, worked as Gosnell’s recovery nurse when Smith was born Sept. 25, 1968. 
Gosnell said he was contacted by Smith’s grandmother and asked to deliver the baby because the usual doctor was caught in a traffic jam. 
Smith was born long before the events which led to Gosnell’s 2013 conviction for killing three infants, along with involuntary manslaughter, after an abortion patient died from results of the procedure. Advertisement – story continues below 
Gosnell is currently serving a life sentence in a state prison in Huntingdon, Pa. 
The doctor was charged with operating a “house of horrors” abortion clinic in the Powelton Village neighborhood of Philadelphia. 
He faced charges that he used scissors to stab some aborted babies that were still alive in a procedure he referred to as “snipping.” He also allegedly fed parts of aborted babies to crabs inhabiting the water near his residence. Advertisement - story continues below Defense Secretary Makes Surprise Trip To Iraq, Vows He’s Not There For The Oil 
Gosnell said he reached out to Smith, in part, because of reports the actor was considering entering politics. 
The convicted doctor used the letter to strike at what he called “gross errors” by the criminal justice system with the hope Smith might want to address them if he were to run for office. 
“My contention is that a politician, relevant for people of color, need be fluent with issues which include: mental health capitation, the public and pharmacology industry’s over-emphasis on `magic bullets,’ intuitive judgements, unconscious attitudes, implicit bias, cognitive bias, acceptable deception and planned deceit,” Gosnell wrote. “Personally, I have confidence in eventual vindication as so many gross errors occurred in my proceedings.” 
Phelim McAleer, who co-authored the book Gosnell: The Untold Story of America’s Most Prolific Serial Killer , says Gosnell believes his conviction was driven largely by the religious beliefs of prosecutors. 
“He believes his case was a persecution by a Catholic-dominated prosecutors’ office,” McAleer said, adding Gosnell believes he will be eventually released from prison. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
